author: Christopher Armstrong
comment: I enjoy using this app. Maybe some previous versions didn't work well, but this one is really great. I really enjoy the widget for Android. I feel like I finally know what's going on in Orlando. $7.99 / month is totally worth it to keep in touch with the community. I already pay $15 / month for the NY Times, so I think this is reasonable. If we want quality journalism in the city we love, we should expect to pay something for it.

author: Pattyfinn H
comment: The notifications are not overwhelming, always interesting and it's easy to navigate through the articles to find topics of Interest.
Sucks...only 5 stories a month. All about $

author: Steve Kauffman
comment: What a pathetic excuse for an app. A corp. this large should be able to afford to get a news app to work. uninstalling and will get my news from a more reliable app. What a shame.....

author: Scott McCoy
comment: Story links slow to respond or does not respond in EVERY session! Occurs on multiple phones. All others apps work fine.

author: Bobby Manso
comment: I wasn't happy they wanted to charge $7.99 to extend the article, to read more news when u could get news others source then it was 10 free story  for a month now they went to 5 I'm going to delete this apps very very very disappointing fail to hear the people just got creedy smh

author: Beth Young
comment: I subscribe to the paper, and I used to like this app because it was easier to see all the latest headlines on the app than on the OS website, plus the OS website annoyingly launches videos automatically on many stories. But lately, I have grown frustrated with the app. Often when I open it, it seems to get stuck. When I get email news alerts and click the links, my phone opens the app but can never find the right story. The ads are really annoying and intrusive, given that I've paid for a subscription. I think the OS could do better. The NYT has an excellent app, and the WaPo app isn't bad either. (The NYT app even displays reader comments, which the OS app has never done.)

author: Amy Lucie
comment: This app has gone through A LOT of changes over the years, but I must say the current version is superb (and they continually work on making it even better). Bravo.

reply.author: tronc Inc.
reply.content:
Amy, 

We're sorry you're encountering issues with the app.  We just released an update that should resolve these issues - if updating to the latest version doesn't address your problem, please email us at Mobile@orlandosentinel.com and we'll help.

author: Erin Mullen
comment: App has become unusable. It used to bug me that I wasn't a subscriber even though I am. Now if you link from Facebook it just freezes. Search function is a joke. Uninstalling.

author: Herodotus of Halicarnassus
comment: OS seems to focus on whether an ad is being fed to a user over the app constantly freezing.

author: Halil Altan
comment: App keeps stopping

author: Spirotek Channel
comment: This app is horrible. Photos lock and dont have headings. Adds popup despite paying for access. Tech support is abismal. Get a clue guys up your tech budget, paper is dead.

Please read fully regarding a better choice. With its limited and sometimes untimely news this app is a 2-Star loser. Annoying payment solicitations promise full news. A better choice, but at a cost, may be the Orlando Sentinel's web edition with full graphics. It's offered free with a traditional home delivery paid subscription. This feature bypasses the app altogether, arriving by email around 5:30am every morning. It is smartphone friendly and very convenient. I love it! (Contact the Orlando Sentinel for details. If subscribing, be patient during the sometimes tedious email setup and learning curve...but worth the effort.)

author: Robert Maxwell
comment: I use it for breaking news. I subscribe to the full edition. I find it slow to respond.

author: John Cyril Cassidy
comment: Quirky and unreliable.H ire a decent developer and you will remove the bugs. You must outsource the app services.
title: Loads slow

author: Bryan Dorion
comment: Slowest news app, period?

author: Rafael Goyco
comment: The app will give you almost what's on the physical paper. Most of the notes seems to be 'cliff notes'. That's where they need to work on.
title: Good but room for improvement

author: Frank Stieg
comment: Good and up to date with local news. Nice and concise - not too wordy. Keep uo the great work!
title: Best source for local news

author: Dave Oconnell
comment: They want to charge you for this information, but nobody else does.  News is not up to date for breaking news.  Quality of what they put on here is poor.
title: Just okay

author: CP Alberts
comment: Orlando sentinel
Don't give up your day job.
title: Confusing to navigate

author: BMCO King
comment: .... It's still constantly updating. The circles round and round endlessly. Subscription cancelled.....It is constantly updating, so you can only get a few stories at a time while the little circles turn and turn... Crap.  This newspaper is such a sad shell of its former glory.   And someone should really get them to define the difference between "top stories" and "breaking news".  The identical stories are in each section. Pointless. The local TV stations cover the same stories, albeit with less depth.
title: S. L. O. W.

author: Marc Ennis
comment: There are way too many ads for a paid subscription. I like to scan the news stories but I keep getting the stupid pizza hut ads, the beach ad, and a couple other constantly in the feed.  I can take a couple ads but  seeing the same ad in my face 20 to 30 times in a course of 10 minutes scrolling through the stories if to much.  Use Google or the ap for your news.
title: You pay for a subscription and to many ads

author: Mark O'Deady
comment: I get Orlando News as it happens with very little drain on my phone resources.
title: Easy and Dependable

author: Sandee Bright
comment: I love the Orlando Sentinel, but this app has sucked since day 1!! EXTREMELY slow response time. Ads appear over the article text even though I'm logged on as a paid digital subscriber. Sometimes it just goes wacky with the articles going over each other when I scroll. If the Internet version of the paper wasn't so hard to see on my phone, I'd uninstall this in a heartbeat! Please invest a little money in a competent programmer & give this app a COMPLETE face-lift! Please!
title: REALLY POOR APP!

author: Rory Salzberg
comment: Slow loading times. Horrible liberal slant on everything,  reading level of a below average fifth grader.
title: Content for fifth graders

author: John Vizzusi
comment: Lets face it.. the Newspaper biz in America is broke. This Orlando Sentinel app lets you read 10 premium stories then it offers you monthly rates to continue. Nerds can simply go System Setting, Apps, find OS, Clear cache, settings etc. The app will start over allowing 10 stories. Then repeat process if you desire to. Online, in your browser its all free! Go figure...
title: Better than old Fishwrap

author: Emily Farwell
comment: what's the point of having a news app if you can't even access ANYTHING without a paid subscription? might as well price this app at $9.99 and save us all the time it takes to download and then immediately uninstall it..
title: worthless...

author: Daryl Fisk
comment: I really enjoy this paper because it goes more in depth than the other news organizations. I went ahead and subscribed. It has paid off nicely.
title: The best news for Orlando

author: Alex Dunigan
comment: There appears to be no logic to display of stories.
title: Confusing

author: Carl Christianson
comment: Use to be better, but better than nothing.

author: Shelley Thompson
comment: What to hell orlando sentinel??? Now all stories are premium and I can only read 10 a month??? Or I can pay extra to read everything.... nope, I'll just continue to use the other free Florida news apps. Big mistake on your part to change to this format. I'm sure your traffic is going to nosedive now!
title: Latest update

author: richard carr
comment: Every story is premium? Well that means none of them are quality. I'll just use a tv news app or something else. Says I've read 10 articles this month. I haven't read one. Wish I could give minus stars.
title: Uninstalling

author: alex vega
comment: I have 4 prints delivered to my home which i pay for. Now i cant even read the news on my phone. What a garbage update. Fire the genious who thought of this. I would give it a 0 but the app doesnt allow me to do so. FIX IT!

I have used this app ever since I've had a smart phone, about six years. I thought the content was unbiased which is the reason I chose it. Now after the recent update I can only read 10 articles before I have to pay!?! Looks like I'll be moving on.... Sad greed has takin over!!
title: Not worth it!

author: Mike Martin
comment: Recent update makes all articles premium. It's one thing to make columnist content premium. But every single piece of news? No thanks.  UPDATE: They released another update, but now, instead of all articles being considered premium (a likely mistake), you are now only able to view 10 articles a month for free. So essentially no change but to confirm that the app is worthless. I'll be going to a new source for news I guess.
title: Latest update makes app not worth it

author: Kimiye T
comment: But I am a print subscriber logged into my unlimited digital account on my phone.  Why can't this app tell that all the articles should be "free" for me? The same account works on the website just fine.
title: Says I'm using up free articles

author: Barry Haupt
comment: I subscribe because I want to read local Orlando news, but this app is sub-par.  My main gripe is that content is very poorly organized.  It's like no one is bothering to figure out what constitutes top news vs. breaking news.  The same story appears multiple times with different dates.  Sometimes photos appear with no text.  Sometimes a photo icon that shows up in story link does not show up in larger form when you open up the story.  Compared to other newspaper apps, this one sucks.
title: Does Not Meet Expectations

author: jaime pollack
comment: Why in the world would I pay for this?? There are so many, way better news apps. I only had this to begin with because it was free, not because it was good.
title: Not paying!

author: Tim Biers
comment: Waste. Even though I subscribe to the print Orlando Sentinel, I can't read the articles. Uninstalled!
